title-group.article-title: Reduction of Air Pollution by control of emission from automotive crankcases

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1960, Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: ANALYSES of crankcase vent gases by several methods have shown that crankcase and exhaust hydrocarbon emissions from automobiles are of the same order of magnitude. Internal ventilation of the crankcase to the engine intake system eliminates crankcase emission, thus providing a practical control of this important source of air pollution.
